intro: Meistera mizoramensis, commonly known as the Mizoram meistera, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in dense tropical forests. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Meistera mizoramensis is considered vulnerable and requires protection to ensure its survival.
